sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics (KITT) Stock Price, Quote, News & History
feed.summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of Nauticus Robotics (KITT) stock, including its current price, news, financial metrics, and analyst ratings. It covers key statistics, recent news headlines, and details on valuation, company debt, and comparisons to competitors. The company develops fully electric autonomous robotic solutions for subsea applications.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics regains compliance with Nasdaq listing standards
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics (NASDAQ: KITT) has announced that it has regained compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price rule. This means the company's common stock has maintained a closing bid price of $1.00 per share or more for at least ten consecutive business days, satisfying Nasdaq Listing Rule 5550(a)(2).

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics stock rises after regaining Nasdaq compliance
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics Inc. (NASDAQ:KITT) shares rose after the company announced it had regained compliance with Nasdaq's continued listing requirements. The subsea robotics firm received formal notice confirming compliance with the equity requirement and will be subject to a Panel Monitor through December 19, 2026. This development removes an immediate delisting threat and allows the company to continue focusing on growth opportunities in the autonomous underwater and software segments.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics regains compliance with Nasdaq listing standards
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. announced it has regained compliance with Nasdaq's continued listing requirements, effective December 19. The company must maintain this compliance through April 14, 2026, and will remain under a mandatory Panel Monitor until December 19, 2026. Despite financial challenges like significant debt and rapid cash burn, analysts anticipate continued sales growth and a potential return to profitability this year for the autonomous subsea robotics developer.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics™ Regains Compliance with Nasdaq Listing Standards
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. announced that it has regained compliance with Nasdaq's continued listing requirements, specifically the equity requirement in Rule 5550(b)(1). The company received formal notice from The Nasdaq Capital Market on December 19, 2025, confirming its compliance. Nauticus must maintain compliance through April 14, 2026, and is subject to a mandatory Panel Monitor until December 19, 2026.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. Regains Nasdaq Compliance
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. announced on December 23, 2025, that it has regained compliance with Nasdaq listing standards, specifically the equity requirement. The company must maintain this compliance until April 14, 2026, and will be under a Panel Monitor until December 19, 2026, as it focuses on autonomous underwater robotics opportunities for 2026.

feed.title: Underwater robotics firm keeps its place on Nasdaq after equity review
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics (KITT) has regained compliance with Nasdaq listing standards, specifically the equity requirement in Rule 5550(b)(1), following a formal notice received on December 19, 2025. This ensures their continued listing, although the company will remain under a mandatory Panel Monitor through December 19, 2026. The company's leadership plans to focus on executing opportunities in autonomous underwater systems and software in 2026, including testing new vehicles and providing subsea robotics services.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics Surges Nearly 11% In Pre-Market Trading — Here's Why It's Trending
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics Inc. (NASDAQ: KITT) saw an 10.90% surge in pre-market trading, following reports that Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick is meeting with robotics industry CEOs and supports efforts to accelerate sector growth. The Trump administration is considering an executive order on robotics for 2026, and the Department of Transportation plans to form a robotics working group. Despite this, KITT has dropped 88.82% year-to-date, with its stock price closing up 115.89% on Wednesday.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics™ and Forum Energy Technologies Expand Subsea Autonomy Through a Manufacturing and Sales Agreement
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics and Forum Energy Technologies have signed a Manufacturing and Sales Agreement to advance subsea autonomy. Under the agreement, Forum Energy Technologies will commercialize, manufacture, and distribute Nauticus' Olympic Arm™ electric manipulator system, combining Nauticus' intelligent manipulation technology with FET's manufacturing capabilities. This collaboration aims to enhance subsea operations through all-electric technologies, improve reliability, and accelerate market penetration for Nauticus' innovations.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics’ Stock Sways Amid Market Buzz
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics Inc. (NASDAQ: KITT) has seen its stock price fall by 9.64% amid market reactions to potentially disruptive developments, including fluctuating investor confidence and inconsistent trading volumes. The company faces challenging financial conditions with an astonishing negative EBIT margin and pretax profit margin, despite a commendable gross margin. Analysts are watching Nauticus' strategic maneuvers, such as capital stock issuance, to see if they can counteract current financial inefficiencies and stabilize future stock behavior.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics Stock Faces Challenges with Adverse Financials
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics Inc. (NASDAQ: KITT) is experiencing a significant stock downturn due to concerns about its robotic technology's market adaptability and adverse financial metrics. The company faces considerable losses, liquidity risks, and operational inefficiencies, dampening investor confidence and growth prospects. Strategic pivots and cost-cutting measures are needed to restore profitability and investor trust.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics (KITT) Stock on December 10, 2025: Debt Swap, Delisting Risk and High‑Beta Deep‑Sea Ambitions
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics (NASDAQ: KITT) is actively engaged in financial engineering to manage its leveraged balance sheet and address Nasdaq listing deficiencies, including a recent debt-for-equity exchange and a $250 million equity line of credit. Despite significant volatility and ongoing losses, the company is pursuing deep-sea rare-earth mineral exploration and expanding commercial deployments of its Aquanaut robots. Analysts highlight both the extreme risks and potential long-term upside, driven by its credible technology and strategic pivot into critical minerals.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics issues Series C preferred stock in exchange for debt
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. (NASDAQ:KITT) has announced an exchange of existing secured convertible debt for newly issued Series C convertible preferred stock with institutional investors. This restructuring aims to address a significant debt burden, as evidenced by the company's $30.92 million debt against a $15.36 million market capitalization. The company also recently reported a Q3 2025 net loss of $6.6 million and is working to comply with Nasdaq listing requirements.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics issues Series C preferred stock in exchange for debt
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics (NASDAQ:KITT) announced an exchange of a portion of its existing secured convertible debt for newly issued Series C convertible preferred stock with institutional investors. This restructuring aims to address the company's significant debt burden, which currently stands at $30.92 million against a market capitalization of $15.36 million. The company issued 3,814 shares of Series C preferred stock in the transaction, which was completed on December 3, 2025.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics details Nasdaq compliance actions and recent equity moves
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics (NASDAQ:KITT) is working to regain compliance with Nasdaq listing requirements after receiving a deficiency notice for failing to meet the minimum market value. The company has undertaken several capital actions, including selling common stock and converting debt to equity, and believes its stockholders' equity now exceeds the required minimum. A decision from the Nasdaq Hearings Panel is pending.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics - Some lenders convert $1.15 million debt to equity under Nov 2024 debentures - SEC filing
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics announced that certain lenders have converted $1.15 million of debt into equity. This conversion is in accordance with debentures issued in November 2024. The information was disclosed in a recent SEC filing.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics Surges Nearly 11% In Pre-Market Trading — Here's Why It's Trending
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics (NASDAQ: KITT) shares surged almost 11% in pre-market trading due to reports of a Trump Administration robotics initiative led by Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick. The administration is reportedly meeting with robotics industry CEOs and considering an executive order for 2026, with the Department of Transportation also planning a robotics working group. While other robotics stocks had mixed performance, Nauticus Robotics has experienced an 88.82% drop year-to-date.

feed.title: Transocean Ltd sells Nauticus Robotics (KITT) stock for $2.16 million
feed.summary: Transocean Ltd. sold 2,357,685 shares of Nauticus Robotics (KITT) stock for $2.16 million in multiple transactions between November 28 and December 3, 2025. Following these sales, Transocean indirectly holds 6,421 shares through a subsidiary, subject to merger agreement price targets. In related news, Nauticus Robotics reported a Q3 2025 net loss of $6.6 million and shareholders approved common stock issuance for Series B Convertible Preferred Stock conversion but rejected a share increase.

feed.title: Is Nauticus Robotics Stock a Hidden Gem?
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics Inc. (KITT) stock has experienced significant volatility and a recent -12.5% decline, despite a new partnership announcement and speculation of a financial infusion. The company reported $1.8M in revenue but faces profitability challenges with a -2,859% EBIT margin, though it maintains a healthy 70.3% gross margin. Investors are watching to see if its technological innovations in marine robotics can translate into sustainable financial gains and redefine the industry.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics Inc - On Dec 3, Enters Amendment And Exchange Agreement - SEC Filing
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics Inc. (KITT) announced on December 3rd that it had entered into an Amendment and Exchange Agreement, as disclosed in an SEC filing. This information was reported by Reuters.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics shareholders approve preferred stock conversion, reject share increase
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. (NASDAQ:KITT) shareholders approved the conversion of Series B Convertible Preferred Stock into common stock, but rejected a proposal to increase the authorized common stock from 625 million to 5 billion. The company also recently reported a Q3 2025 net loss of $6.6 million on $1.9 million in revenue, with an EPS of -$2.6.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics Secures $250 Million Equity Facility and Launches Strategic Initiative to Enter Deep-Sea Rare Earth Mineral Exploration Market
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. has secured a $250 million Equity Line of Credit (ELOC) to fund growth and strategically enter the deep-sea rare earth and mineral exploration market. This initiative aims to leverage Nauticus' advanced robotics to acquire technologies and partnerships for responsible exploration of critical minerals. The move aligns with global energy transition needs and the securing of strategic minerals.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics Announces Receipt of Stock Exchange Delisting Notification
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. (NASDAQ: KITT) has received a Nasdaq delisting notification because its Market Value of Listed Securities (MVLS) fell below the required $35 million. The company plans to request a hearing to pause any delisting action and is evaluating options to regain compliance, including corporate or market-based actions. Nauticus Robotics expects its common stock to continue trading on The Nasdaq Capital Market under the symbol "KITT" while it works towards compliance.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics Certifies Nauticus ToolKITT™ Autonomy Software on Light Work-Class ROVs; Completes First Paid Commercial Operation on a Retrofitted System
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. announced the successful certification and commercial deployment of its Nauticus ToolKITT™ autonomy software on retrofitted light work-class ROVs. This marks the first time their autonomy software has been used on a third-party ROV platform, enabling semi-autonomous operations and demonstrating the flexibility of ToolKITT™. The technology reduces pilot workload and enhances mission consistency for the offshore industry.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics Announces Results for the Third Quarter of 2025
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. announced its financial results for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, highlighting "breakthrough" advancements in its ROV and Aquanaut programs, successful integration of Nauticus ToolKITT™ on third-party vehicles, and increased customer interest. The company reported a revenue of $2.0 million for the third quarter and an adjusted net loss of $6.8 million, while customer demand and partnerships for new workflows continue to grow. Nauticus is focused on expanding its customer base for software sales in 2026 and developing new capabilities for the upcoming offshore season.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics aims for deep-sea rare mineral exploration with $250M line of credit
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics Inc. has secured a $250 million equity line of credit to fund its expansion into deep-sea rare earth and mineral exploration. This initiative is part of a broader strategy to leverage its autonomous subsea robotics technology for industries crucial to the global energy transition, including potential strategic acquisitions. The company also plans to convert $3.7 million of debt into common equity to strengthen its balance sheet and address Nasdaq de-listing concerns.

feed.title: Nauticus (NASDAQ: KITT) launches deep-sea rare earth strategy, backed by $250M equity line
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics (NASDAQ: KITT) has secured a $250 million equity line of credit to fund strategic acquisitions and accelerate its entry into the deep-sea rare earth and mineral exploration market. This initiative aims to leverage the company's autonomous subsea robotics, AI, and automation capabilities, targeting businesses and technologies that complement its existing portfolio. The move supports U.S. strategic mineral priorities and follows Nauticus' recent acquisition of SeaTrepid to expand its subsea service and ROV capabilities.

feed.title: Nauticus (NASDAQ: KITT) to convert $3.7M debt; holders may exchange into preferred equity
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics announced an agreement to convert $3.7 million of existing debt into common equity to substantially deleverage its balance sheet. Debtholders have also agreed to exchange outstanding debt into preferred equity if required, aiming to help the company comply with NASDAQ listing issues. This move is expected to improve financial flexibility, though it could lead to share dilution for existing shareholders.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics to Participate in Water Tower Research Fireside Chat this Wednesday, October 15, 2025
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics will participate in a fireside chat hosted by Water Tower Research on October 15, 2025. The discussion will cover Nauticus' autonomous underwater drone technologies, their market, and financial implications. Investors can register via Water Tower Research to learn about the company's progress and strategy.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics to Participate in Water Tower Research Fireside Chat this Wednesday, October 15, 2025 - Stock Titan
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics (NASDAQ: KITT) announced that President and CEO John Gibson will participate in a Water Tower Research Fireside Chat on Wednesday, October 15, 2025. The discussion will cover Nauticus' autonomous underwater drone (AUD) technology, its addressable markets in offshore oil & gas, wind, and defense, customer cost savings, emissions reductions, recent Aquanaut Mark 2 deep-sea tests to 2,300 meters, and the company’s capital-light, royalty-based scaling strategy. The event is open to all investors for registration via Water Tower Research's webinar link.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics (KITT) Aquanaut Mark 2 Reaches 2,300m Depth in Louisiana Test
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. (KITT) successfully tested its Aquanaut Mark 2 underwater vehicle off the coast of Louisiana, reaching a record depth of 2,300 meters. This untethered autonomous trial demonstrated improved operational skills and the potential to significantly reduce subsea costs for oil and gas clients. Nauticus Robotics is a robotic services, vehicle sales, and software licensing company for maritime industries, with a strategic partnership with Leidos Holdings, Inc.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics Announces 1-for-9 Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. (NASDAQ: KITT) announced a 1-for-9 reverse stock split to increase its share price and comply with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. The reverse split is expected to be effective on September 05, 2025, with post-split trading commencing at market open under the same symbol. This action aims to attract a broader range of investors, including institutional investors, without altering current shareholders' ownership percentages or the company's overall value.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics Announces 1-for-9 Reverse Stock Split
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. announced a 1-for-9 reverse stock split to increase its share price and comply with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. The reverse split is expected to become effective on September 5, 2025, with trading on a post-split basis beginning the same day. This action will not change current investors' ownership percentages or the overall value of Nauticus.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics Lands 6 New Customers as Underwater Robots Ready for 2,200m Depths
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics (NASDAQ: KITT) reported completing projects for six new customers across the wind and energy sectors in Q2 2025, anticipating record-breaking revenue for the year. The company expects to initiate Aquanaut® revenue in Q3 2025, with its autonomous underwater vehicle operating at ultra-deepwater depths of up to 2,200 meters by summer's end. This expansion signifies increased market diversification and a critical milestone in the commercialization of their autonomous technology.

feed.title: Leidos and Nauticus Robotics Forge Subsea Strategic Alliance
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. and Leidos have formed a strategic alliance to advance subsea autonomy solutions, building on a prior successful collaboration. This partnership aims to combine their expertise to develop next-generation autonomous underwater systems for complex missions. Nauticus will contribute its Aquanaut system and ToolKITT software platform to enhance future unmanned underwater vehicles.

feed.title: Nauticus wraps up autonomous, tether-less survey for Shell in Gulf of Mexico
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics has successfully completed an initial autonomous, tether-less survey for Shell Exploration and Production Inc. in the Gulf of Mexico, covering inactive and active assets off Louisiana at depths up to 1,000 meters. This project demonstrates Nauticus's viable product in a deepwater environment, contributing to its growing 2025 commercial work pipeline. The company recently began commercial operations of its Aquanaut Mark 2 underwater vehicle and secured over $12 million in funding to accelerate the certification of its robots.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics Announces Notification of NASDAQ Listing Extension
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics Inc. (NASDAQ: KITT) has received an extension from Nasdaq until December 31, 2024, to regain compliance with listing standards. The company remains listed on the Nasdaq Capital Market and will continue to implement its compliance plan presented on September 5, 2024. Nauticus Robotics specializes in autonomous subsea robotics and software for ocean industries.

feed.title: Phase 1 of Aquanaut Mark 2 project successfully completed
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. has successfully completed and invoiced Phase I of a four-phase contract for its Aquanaut Mark 2 project with a leading offshore oil and gas operator in Brazil. This phase involved finalizing engineering documentation and proof of concept, ensuring the vehicle meets ten essential functionalities for deepwater inspection and maintenance. The company is now proceeding with Phases II and III, with the final field qualification test scheduled for Brazil.

feed.title: Nauticus Advances Autonomous Solutions Project with Brazil Operator
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics has completed Phase I of a four-phase contract with Brazil's largest offshore oil and gas operator, focusing on autonomous solutions for deepwater field inspection. This phase involved engineering and proof-of-concept documentation for the Aquanaut Mark 2 vehicle, leveraging Nauticus' ToolKITT software. The project aims to revolutionize subsea operations, improving efficiency, safety, and reducing CO2 emissions, with subsequent phases involving technology integration, testing, and field qualification in Brazil.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics to enact 1-for-36 reverse stock split
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, Inc. announced a 1-for-36 reverse stock split of its common stock, effective July 22, 2024, to meet Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirements and attract institutional investors. This strategic move follows a recent Q1 2024 profit and aggressive cost-cutting, despite significant debt and declining revenue. The company aims to enhance its market position and secure financial flexibility for future growth, particularly focusing on its Aquanaut ToolKITT product.

feed.title: Former Nauticus Robotics CEO starts new humanoid robotics company
feed.summary: Nicolaus Radford, former CEO of Nauticus Robotics, has launched a new humanoid robotics company named Persona AI. This venture marks his return to the robotics industry after taking Nauticus Robotics public. The article highlights that Radford couldn't stay away from the field of robotics.

feed.title: Nauticus Robotics secures over $12M to propel Aquanaut’s autonomous exploration
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics has secured over $12 million in investment to accelerate the commercialization of its Aquanaut robot, designed for subsea inspection and maintenance. The company is preparing Aquanaut for its first commercial job in the Gulf of Mexico and has realigned its management team and go-to-market strategy, including a focus on "tethered/augmented autonomy" for existing subsea vehicles using its toolKITT software. This strategy aims to improve efficiency, lower emissions, and continue funding the development of fully autonomous Aquanaut platforms.

feed.title: Undersea robotics company founded by NASA engineers sees leadership shakeups
feed.summary: Nauticus Robotics, an undersea robotics company based in Webster, TX, announced significant leadership changes at the start of the new year, with CEO and founder Nicolaus Radford and COO Donnelly Bohan departing. John W. Gibson Jr. was promoted to interim CEO as the company seeks to balance its defense and commercial-sector management. Despite ambitious plans including a public merger and investor funding, Nauticus Robotics has faced mounting losses, reporting a $11.1 million loss in the first three quarters of 2023.

feed.title: Space to Sea: An Underwater Robot Takes a Deep Dive
feed.summary: Engineers who previously developed robot astronauts at NASA's Johnson Space Center are now applying their expertise to create the Aquanaut, a shape-changing submersible robot for maritime industries. This robot aims to significantly reduce operational costs for offshore activities like oil wells, wind turbines, and fish farms by enabling tasks with minimal human supervision and eliminating the need for expensive support vessels. The Aquanaut's design leverages lessons from space robotics, emphasizing autonomy and remote operation in harsh, distant environments, making it versatile for various subsea jobs.

feed.title: Houston robotics company secures multi-million-dollar government contract
feed.summary: Webster-based Nauticus Robotics Inc. has secured a second multimillion-dollar contract from the U.S. Defense Innovation Unit for the development of a self-piloted amphibious robot system. This new contract builds on a previous agreement where Nauticus' ToolKITT software is used in remotely controlled undersea Navy vehicles. The company, which recently went public, is forecasting $90 million in revenue for 2023 and develops oceangoing robots and autonomous software.

feed.title: Houston-based robotics tech company goes public via SPAC
feed.summary: Houston-based Nauticus Robotics Inc. has gone public on the NASDAQ under the ticker KITT after merging with BlankTech Acquisition Corp. The company aims for $90 million in revenue next year, driven by its robotic fleet and RaaS platform, targeting the oil and gas, offshore renewables, and government sectors. Founder and CEO Nicolaus Radford sees this as a pivotal step in transforming the ocean robotics industry with autonomous systems.

feed.title: CleanTech Acquisition Corp. and Nauticus Robotics, Inc. Complete Business Combination
feed.summary: CleanTech Acquisition Corp. and Nauticus Robotics, Inc. have successfully completed their business combination, with the combined company operating as Nauticus Robotics, Inc. The company's common stock and public warrants will begin trading on NASDAQ under the symbols “KITT” and “KITTW” starting September 13, 2022. This merger aims to transform the ocean robotics industry with autonomous systems and accelerate Nauticus' growth trajectory.
